item.title: 即使市场反弹，特朗普的决策仍令市场焦虑不安
item.description: 随着华尔街将四月份的关税震荡纳入后视镜，股指创下历史新高，投资者对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的快速、有时甚至是混乱的决策过程仍然保持警惕，并认为反弹是脆弱的。【原文：As Wall Street puts April's tariff shakeout in the rearview mirror and indexes set record highs, investors remain wary of U.S. President Donald Trump's rapid-fire, sometimes chaotic policymaking process and see the rally as fragile.】

item.title: 美国司法部就 HPE 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络的反垄断案达成和解
item.description: 据法院文件显示，美国司法部已就质疑服务器制造商惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise）以 140 亿美元全现金收购瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）的诉讼达成和解。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice has settled its lawsuit challenging server maker Hewlett Packard Enterprise's all-cash acquisition of Juniper Networks for $14 billion, according to court filings.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，因气囊密封不当，Stellantis 将召回超过 25 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周六表示，由于侧帘式安全气囊密封不当，克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特将在美国召回250,651辆汽车。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis is recalling 250,651 vehicles in the U.S. due to an improperly sealed side curtain air bag, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Saturday.】

item.title: 巴菲特捐赠创纪录的 60 亿美元伯克希尔股票
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特周五又向盖茨基金会和四个家族慈善机构捐赠了 60 亿美元的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司股票，这是他近二十年前开始捐赠财产以来最大的一笔年度捐赠。【原文：Warren Buffett donated on Friday another $6 billion of Berkshire Hathaway stock to the Gates Foundation and four family charities, his biggest annual donation since he began giving away his fortune nearly two decades ago.】

item.title: 独家：英特尔最高战略官将于本月离职
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，英特尔最高战略主管 Safroadu Yeboah-Amankwah 即将离职，这是自今年 3 月陈立武执掌这家芯片制造商以来的最新变动。【原文：Intel's top strategy executive, Safroadu Yeboah-Amankwah, is departing the company, the latest change since Lip-Bu Tan took the chipmaker's helm in March, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 科技公司警告称 "分散蜘蛛 "黑客正瞄准航空业
item.description: 谷歌和 Palo Alto Networks 等科技公司对 "Scattered Spider "黑客组织对航空领域的兴趣敲响了警钟。【原文：Tech companies Google and Palo Alto Networks are sounding the alarm over the "Scattered Spider" hacking group's interest in the aviation sector.】

item.title: 特朗普称不会任命不支持降息的人进入美联储
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周五表示，他不会任命任何不会在现有基础上降低利率的人担任美联储主席，这或许是对下一任央行行长候选人进行的最明确的试金石测试，要求他们与他的大幅降息要求保持一致，以获得这份工作。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he would not appoint anyone to head the Federal Reserve who would not lower interest rates from where they are, setting perhaps the most explicit litmus test yet for candidates to be the next central bank chief to align with his demands for steep rate cuts in order to get the job.】

item.title: 瑞波公司首席执行官表示，将放弃在加密货币诉讼案中对美国证券交易委员会的交叉上诉
item.description: 加密货币公司瑞波实验室首席执行官周五表示，该公司将撤回对美国证券交易委员会的交叉上诉，这场旷日持久的法律战与其 XRP 代币的销售有关。【原文：Ripple Labs will withdraw its cross appeal against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission in a prolonged legal battle tied to the sale of its XRP tokens, the crypto firm's CEO said on Friday.】

item.title: 加拿大钢铁生产商告诉政府其关税保护措施还不够
item.description: 加拿大钢铁业代表在本周的一次会议上告诉政府官员，他们为保护钢铁业免受美国关税影响而采取的措施是不够的。【原文：Canadian steel industry representatives told government officials in a meeting this week that their measures to protect the industry from the consequences of U.S. tariffs are insufficient, two of the representatives who attended the meeting told Reuters.】

item.title: 通用汽车获胜，上诉法院取消变速箱诉讼资格
item.description: 通用汽车公司周五说服联邦上诉法院取消了一项集体诉讼的资格，该集体诉讼要求通用汽车公司为在知情的情况下销售约80万辆变速箱有问题的轿车、卡车和越野车承担责任。【原文：General Motors persuaded a federal appeals court on Friday to decertify a class action seeking to hold the automaker liable for knowingly selling about 800,000 cars, trucks and SUVs with faulty transmissions.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，GE Vernova 探讨出售 Proficy 软件部门
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，美国电力设备制造商 GE Vernova 正在探索出售其工业软件业务 Proficy，交易价格可能高达 10 亿美元。【原文：U.S. power equipment maker GE Vernova is exploring the sale of its industrial software business, Proficy, in a deal that could fetch as much as $1 billion, Bloomberg Newsreported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，OpenAI 转而使用谷歌的人工智能芯片为其产品提供动力
item.description: 据《The Information》周五援引一位知情人士的话报道，OpenAI 最近开始租用谷歌的人工智能芯片，为 ChatGPT 和其他产品提供动力。【原文：OpenAI has recently begun renting Google's artificial intelligence chips to power ChatGPT and other products, The Information reported on Friday, citing a person involved in the arrangement.】

item.title: 特朗普表示希望将利率降至 1%，并 "希望 "鲍威尔辞职
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，他 "非常希望 "美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔辞职，他还表示希望将利率降至1%。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he would "love" if Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell were to resign, and the president also said he wanted interest rates cut to 1%.】

item.title: 加州立法机构采取行动将电影和电视制作留在本土
item.description: 根据民主党领导的立法机构周五通过的一项措施，好莱坞的家乡加利福尼亚州将把每年用于电影和电视制作的税收优惠政策提高一倍多，达到 7.5 亿美元。【原文：Hollywood's home state of California will more than double annual tax incentives for film and television production to $750 million under a measure passed by the Democratic-led legislature on Friday.】

item.title: 交易日 华尔街的双峰
item.description: - 交易日【原文：- TRADING DAY】

item.title: 美联储称银行在假想的经济衰退中仍有活力，为资本计划扫清障碍
item.description: 美联储周五发布报告称，美国最大的 22 家银行已做好准备，能够经受住假想的严重经济衰退并继续放贷，即使在遭受数千亿美元的损失后，这些银行仍能保持稳健的资本水平。【原文：Twenty-two of the largest banks in the U.S. are well-positioned to weather a hypothetical severe economic downturn and continue lending, with firms maintaining robust capital levels even after suffering hundreds of billions of dollars in losses, the Federal Reserve reported on Friday.】

item.title: 标准普尔 500 指数创纪录，得益于盈利强劲和关税担忧缓解
item.description: 投资者已从对关税的恐慌转向宽松买盘，使美国股市重回历史高位，因为在政策剧变时期，企业盈利和美国经济的表现好于许多人的预期。【原文：Investors have shifted from panicking about tariffs to relief buying, lifting the U.S. stock market storm back to record highs as corporate earnings and the U.S. economy held up better than many had expected through a period of dramatic policy change.】

item.title: 美洲开发银行批准为巴西提供 20 亿美元信贷额度
item.description: 美洲开发银行（IDB）周五表示，该行批准了 20 亿美元的有条件信贷额度，用于加强巴西的财政管理。【原文：The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) approved a conditional credit line of $2 billion to strengthen fiscal management in Brazil, it said on Friday.】

item.title: KKR 支持的 NIQ 申请在美国上市
item.description: 由投资巨头 KKR 支持的消费者洞察公司 NIQ Global 周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：NIQ Global, a consumer insights company backed by investment giant KKR , filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Friday.】

item.title: 监管机构称，加州应支持燃料进口，想方设法留住炼油商
item.description: 加利福尼亚州能源监管机构周五向州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）提出建议，支持及时进口燃料，并探讨如何保留该州现有炼油厂的运营。【原文：California's energy regulator on Friday issued recommendations to Governor Gavin Newsom to support timely fuel imports and explore ways to retain operations at existing refineries in the state.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，Meta 向私人资本公司寻求 290 亿美元，用于建设人工智能数据中心
item.description: 据《金融时报》周五报道，Meta Platforms 正寻求从私人资本公司融资 290 亿美元，用于建设人工智能数据中心。【原文：Meta Platforms is seeking to raise $29 billion from private capital firms to build artificial intelligence data centers, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 特斯拉提前完成首批全自动驾驶 Model Y 交付
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周五表示，首次完全自主地将 Model Y 从工厂运送到城市另一端的客户家中，比原定计划提前一天完成。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Friday that the first fully autonomous delivery of Model Y from the factory to a customer's home across town was completed a day ahead of schedule.】

item.title: 美国航空公司称技术问题影响部分系统
item.description: 美国航空公司周五表示，一个技术问题影响了部分系统的连接，导致航班延误。【原文：American Airlines said on Friday a technology issue was affecting connectivity for some systems, causing flight delays.】

item.title: 立法者希望美国商务部调查中国智能手机制造商一加
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封信，两名美国议员周五要求商务部调查中国智能手机制造商一加在美国销售的设备是否存在安全问题。【原文：Two U.S. lawmakers on Friday asked the Commerce Department to investigate whether devices sold by Chinese smartphone maker OnePlus in the United States pose security concerns, according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国能源公司 EQT 同意以 1.675 亿美元结案
item.description: 根据原告周四向联邦法院提交的文件，美国能源公司 EQT 同意支付 1.675 亿美元，以了结投资者提起的集体诉讼，这些投资者声称 EQT 夸大了其 2017 年与莱斯能源公司（Rice Energy）67 亿美元合并的收益。【原文：U.S. energy company EQT agreed to pay $167.5 million to settle a class action lawsuit filed by investors who claimed EQT overstated the benefits of its $6.7 billion merger with Rice Energy in 2017, according to a federal court filing on Thursday by the plaintiffs.】

item.title: 白金股权投资公司支持的麦格劳希尔申请在美国上市
item.description: 由投资公司 Platinum Equity 支持的教育课程提供商麦格劳-希尔公司周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：McGraw Hill, an educational courses provider backed by investment firm Platinum Equity, filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Friday.】

item.title: 公司称，特朗普希望 EchoStar 与联邦通信委员会就无线许可证达成 "友好 "协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在本周五提交的一份文件中说，本月早些时候，他敦促 Dish TV 母公司 EchoStar Corp 和联邦通信委员会主席布兰登-卡尔（Brendan Carr）就该公司无线频谱许可证的命运达成友好协议。【原文：President Donald Trump prodded Dish TV parent EchoStar Corp and Federal Communications Commission Chair Brendan Carr earlier this month to reach an amicable deal over the fate of the company's wireless spectrum licenses, the company said in a filing on Friday.】

item.title: 美国制裁后，墨西哥 Terrafina 将取消 CIBanco 的托管人身份
item.description: 墨西哥房地产信托公司 Terrafina 周五表示，由于受到美国洗钱指控，该公司计划解除 CIBanco 银行的受托人职务，这导致墨西哥银行监管机构介入管理。【原文：Mexican real estate trust Terrafina said on Friday it planned to remove bank CIBanco as its trustee due to U.S. money laundering accusations, which resulted in Mexico's banking regulator stepping in to manage it.】

item.title: 在货币困境中，玻利维亚加密货币交易量增长超过 530
item.description: 路透社的一篇报道显示，越来越多的玻利维亚人开始转向Binance等加密货币交易所和Tether等稳定币，以对冲当地玻利瓦尔货币的贬值。【原文：Bolivia's central bank on Friday reiterated a dramatic uptick in transactions of digital assets, following a Reuters report that showed how more Bolivians were turning to crypto exchanges like Binance and stablecoins like Tether as a hedge against the depreciation of the local boliviano currency.】

item.title: 特斯拉未能终止佛罗里达州有关 Model S 致命车祸的诉讼
item.description: 特斯拉未能说服联邦法官结束对一名妇女在佛罗里达州基拉戈（Key Largo）因一辆配备自动驾驶功能的 Model S 冲出路面后被撞身亡的诉讼，这为下个月可能进行的审判铺平了道路。【原文：Tesla failed to persuade a federal judge to end a lawsuit over the death of a woman struck after an Autopilot-equipped Model S ran off the road in Key Largo, Florida, paving the way for a possible trial next month.】
